DataElement.preferredName: Donor Cellular Infusion Source Negative Fraction CD34 Antigen Positive Selection Bone Marrow Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A form of adoptive immunotherapy used after hematopoietic stem cell transplantation (HSCT). Lymphocytes from the original stem cell donor are given to the HSCT recipient, after the transplant, to augment an antitumor immune response (graft-versus-tumor), or ensure that the donor stem cells remain engrafted. Although lymphocytes are the most commonly used cell, other cells including fibroblasts, mesenchymal or dendritic cells may be delivered to affect chimerism, treat Graft vs. Host Disease, treat viral infections or Post Transplant Lymphoproliferative Disease or other novel uses under investigation._Where something is available or from where it originates._Involving disadvantage or harm._A part, a fragment of a whole._Glycoproteins found on immature hematopoietic cells and endothelial cells. They are the only molecules to date whose expression within the blood system is restricted to a small number of progenitor cells in the bone marrow._The separation of specific cells or cell populations from a heterogeneous mixture. Specifically it refers to the selective retention of a population of desired cells through recognition of cells bearing the specified characteristics._The soft, sponge-like tissue in the center of bones that produces white blood cells, red blood cells, and platelets._Indicator of Yes, No, Unknown, Not Done, or Not Applicable to a question.[manually curated]

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A form of adoptive immunotherapy used after hematopoietic stem cell transplantation (HSCT). Lymphocytes from the original stem cell donor are given to the HSCT recipient, after the transplant, to augment an antitumor immune response (graft-versus-tumor), or ensure that the donor stem cells remain engrafted. Although lymphocytes are the most commonly used cell, other cells including fibroblasts, mesenchymal or dendritic cells may be delivered to affect chimerism, treat Graft vs. Host Disease, treat viral infections or Post Transplant Lymphoproliferative Disease or other novel uses under investigation.:Source; where something is available.

Concepts.definition: A form of adoptive immunotherapy used after hematopoietic stem cell transplantation (HSCT). Lymphocytes from the original stem cell donor are given to the HSCT recipient, after the transplant, to augment an antitumor immune response (graft-versus-tumor), or ensure that the donor stem cells remain engrafted. Although lymphocytes are the most commonly used cell, other cells including fibroblasts, mesenchymal or dendritic cells may be delivered to affect chimerism, treat Graft vs. Host Disease, treat viral infections or Post Transplant Lymphoproliferative Disease or other novel uses under investigation.
Where something is available or from where it originates.

Property.preferredName: Negative Fractions CD34 Antigen Positive Selection Bone Marrow
Property.preferredDefinition: Negative; involving disadvantage or harm.:Fraction; a small part or item forming a piece of a whole.:A protein found on the surface of some bone marrow and blood cells.:The separation of specific cells or cell populations from a heterogeneous mixture. Specifically it refers to the selective retention of a population of desired cells through recognition of cells bearing the specified characteristics.:The soft, sponge-like tissue in the center of bones that produces white blood cells, red blood cells, and platelets.

Concepts.definition: A part, a fragment of a whole.
Hematopoietic progenitor cell antigen CD34 (385 aa, ~41 kDa) is encoded by the human CD34 gene. This protein plays a role in cell-cell adhesion and may have a role in leukocyte migration.
The selective retention of a population of desired cells through recognition of cells bearing specific characteristics.
The tissue occupying the spaces of bone. It consists of blood vessel sinuses and a network of hematopoietic cells which give rise to the red cells, white cells, and megakaryocytes.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).
